title: Hassles of Cross-Border Trains Hamper EU’s Green Ambitions
description: One man is on a mission to find and suggest fixes for all of the flaws making international rail travel in Europe surprisingly hard. Getting more people on trains is key to meeting E.U. climate goals.
dc:creator: Erika Solomon
media:credit: Emile Ducke for The New York Times
media:description: At the railway station in Rumburk, Czech Republic, on the border with Germany. “We need to get more people on trains,” said Jon Worth, the self-appointed monitor of Europe’s railroad system.
